title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts reports its seventh pediatric flu-related death this season among 260 total flu fatalities.
260 people have died from flu-related causes in Massachusetts, with flu activity straining healthcare facilities.
Public health officials emphasize vaccination for children, older adults, and those with health conditions.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department's Valentine's Day post asks residents to report exes with outstanding warrants.
The tongue-in-cheek post includes a flyer and has garnered nearly 7,000 likes on Facebook.
Similar Valentine's Day initiatives have been used by police departments in New Hampshire, Ohio, Nebraska, and New York.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer will alternate between second and third base during Red Sox spring training in Fort Myers, Fla.
The Red Sox are evaluating infield positions with Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer as top candidates for third base.
Manager Alex Cora aims to finalize the Red Sox infield lineup soon, focusing on reducing errors from previous seasons.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Ashton Grant will remain with the New England Patriots, declining NFL offensive coordinator interviews, according to ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Grant played a key role in quarterback Drake Maye's performance, leading to his near MVP award and Patriots' Super Bowl appearance.
Previously a wide receiver at Assumption University, Grant started his coaching career at Holy Cross and joined the Browns in 2020.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Matt's Barber Shop in Brighton was flooded due to a burst pipe after upstairs tenants turned off their heat.
Customer Dietrich Warner launched a GoFundMe for the shop, raising over $25,800 in community donations by February 13.
A benefit show is planned at O'Brien’s Pub on February 19 to support the shop's rebuilding efforts.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity' featuring Elizabeth Olsen is now streaming on Apple TV about a woman choosing between her two deceased husbands.
'Dawson's Creek', a teen drama starring the late James Van Der Beek, is available on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi.
Season 10 of 'Love Is Blind', focusing on unique dating scenarios, is currently streaming on Netflix.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge ruled that two storybooks on gender stereotypes are outside a lawsuit by a Lexington parent.
The parent's lawsuit addresses LGBTQ-related lessons but does not cover books like 'Pink Is For Boys' and 'Except When They Don't'.
The court held that educators are not required to let the child opt out of lessons using the two books in dispute.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony, 21, will join Team USA as an injury replacement for Corbin Carroll, pending a physical examination.
Anthony, recovering from an oblique injury, will have a physical on Saturday to determine his eligibility for Team USA.
Reliever Garrett Whitlock joins Anthony as the only Red Sox players on Team USA for the World Baseball Classic.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: A $20 million penthouse at Ocean House, Westerly, Rhode Island, is on the market with luxury amenities.
The 4,696 square-foot penthouse was created by combining two units and includes three bedrooms and four bathrooms.
Owners gain access to amenities such as a lap pool, gym, spa, private beach, and dining options at the Ocean House Club.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics are 35-19, second in the Eastern Conference, driven by a major roster overhaul and Jaylen Brown's scoring.
The team ranks top three in both offensive and defensive ratings, crucial for championship contenders in recent years.
Struggles arise in clutch games, owning a 12-14 record, the lowest among current playoff teams.
